collection.title: Applying periodic anthelmintic treatments to all dogs (for E. granulosus s.l.)
Preventing dogs from accessing carcasses of dead animals (for E. granulosus)
Vaccinating sheep with recombinant vaccine (for E. granulosus s.l.)
Baiting foxes with anthelmintic drug (for E. multilocularis)
Washing hands (for both E. granulosus s.l. and multilocularis)
Using personal protective equipment (for both E. granulosus s.l. and multilocularis)
Conducting visual inspections of carcasses by the competent authority (for E. granulosus s.l.)
Tracing back infections at farms (for E. granulosus s.l.)
Avoiding the ingestion of raw food or water from potentially contaminated areas (for both E. granulosus s.l. and multilocularis)
Washing raw food thoroughly before eating (for both E. granulosus s.l. and multilocularis)
Washing hands thoroughly (for both E. granulosus s.l. and multilocularis)
Implementing the “Five Keys to Safer Food”, which were developed by WHO to educate consumers and food handlers on safe food handling behaviour
